Birmingham will host the 2022 Commonwealth Games. The Games are expected to take place between 27 July and 7 August 2022. Birmingham has a wealth of existing sports venues
column2: arenas and conference halls that are ideal for hosting sport during the Games. Alexander Stadium
column3: which will host the ceremonies and athletics
column4: will be renovated and the capacity will be increased to 40
column5: 000 seats. The 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham are expected to generate a £526 million boost to the West Midlands regional economy. The official handover to Birmingham took place at the Gold Coast 2018 Commonwealth Games closing ceremony on 15 April 2018.
